IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We are removing overhead electricity cables and replacing them with new underground electricity cables along with replacing some poles. To complete the work safely we need to turn your power off. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors Avidety may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. This work is taking place near Lomas Lane. Please note there will be several vehicles in the area.

Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place near Rattlesden Road.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Lowestoft Road.

We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced multiple unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Stonepit Lane.

Steps.Message: Good afternoon, this is a message from Alicia at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut which is currently in progress today the 13th November 2025 in the CB8 postcode area. The power was switched off at 09:00 by our engineers to enable a third party to carry out tree trimming safely around our overhead electricity cables in Lidgate. Our engineers have advised us that works have gone well, and the 36 affected properties will be restored early at approximately 13:50. Once completed and power have been restored to the area it has reduced the possibility of you having an unplanned power cut by stopping these trees from potentially causing damage to our overhead electricity network and have given the third party their desired outcome. Our reference number for this work is INCD-22095-O. I hope that the power coming on earlier is of benefit to you. We always aim to provide a 10/10 service, if you feel we have not delivered you a 10/10 service then please call us on 105. Thank you

Steps.Message: Good afternoon, this is a message from Harry at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut which is currently in progress today the 13th November 2025 in the PE28 postcode area. The power was switched off to enable our engineers to trim trees that had grown close to the overhead electricity cables near Fen End. Our engineers have advised us that the 35 affected properties will be restored early by approximately 14:30. This is due to the works progressing well and being completed ahead of schedule. Once these works are complete this will improve the reliability of the electricity network and reduce the risk of you having a tree related unplanned power cut. Our reference number for this work is INCD-104590-C. I hope that the power coming on earlier is of benefit to you. We always aim to provide a 10/10 service, if you feel we have not delivered you a 10/10 service then please call us on 105.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified a piece of equipment called a transformer that needs replacing and upgrading. Once completed this work will improve the reliability of the electricity network and help to provide additional capacity for new low carbon technologies such as heat pumps and electric vehicle chargers. Doing this will also reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate that some customers have been affected by multiple unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off and upgrade the transformer. We will remove the existing one and install a new one on the same day. This work is taking place near Palehouse Common.

Steps.Message:
Good afternoon, this is a message from Donna at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut that is scheduled for today the 13th November 2025 in the IP26 postcode area.
Our contractors have advised us that due some other works in the area they need to delay switching off your power this afternoon. We now estimate to switch off your power at approximately 14:00, we are unsure if this will impact the time your power will be restored but as soon as we have any further information, we will let you know.
Our reference number for this work is INCD-105119-C.
We would like to apologise for any inconvenience this may cause you. If you have any questions or you have moved from the IP29 postcode area, then please call 105. Thank you.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

This work is taking place in 2 locations in the Harrow Lane area.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 17:21 - Thanks for your patience this evening.

Our staff are currently checking our network equipment throughout the area. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Will at 17:13 - I appreciate your continued patience during the power cut today. Our staff are working as quickly as they can to get the lights back on, and they've advised us that there are now 262 properties still affected. They have managed to get a further 136 of our customers back on by diverting electricity, so your power may have come on sooner than we originally advised. If you're still off, please don't worry; work on the issue will continue along with SMS updates until everyone is back on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Woodbridge, IP12 2 and IP13 0 area and are investigating the fault. You may find your power is going on and off; that is normal for this type of issue and is due to our engineers working to divert power remotely. By doing this, we've managed to restore power to 107 customers. There are now 398 properties still affected. We'll keep sending SMS updates until everybody is restored. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Sent by Will at 16:55.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is Will from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I'm sorry for the power cut today; I know the lights going off can be disruptive.

We know that some customers affected by todays power cut may have had other issues recently, and I appreciate this is frustrating. High voltage cabling can cover a wide area, so sometimes properties very close to you may have had power cuts that you didn't experience.

I know you may not have had any previous power cuts, but if you have, we often get progress updates from our field staff management about investigations into repeat issues, and our Customer Services team will try to contact everyone affected by them to explain what's happening.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 16:20 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is an overhead network fault affecting 505 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between  17:30 and 18:30. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 10:16 - We can now confirm that all power in the Station Road area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Kevin at 09:54
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Station Road area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of between 11:30 and 12:30 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Kevin at 09:11.

Sent by Kevin at 08:23 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 898 customers in the Harwich CO12 4 area, by diverting power around an underground network fault. We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.

We understand how difficult a power cut can be, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Brighton, BN1 area to investigate the power cut affecting 56 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Adam at 13:07.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Adam at 12:56 - I appreciate your continued patience during the power cut today. Our staff are working as quickly as they can to get the lights back on, and they've advised us that there are now 56 properties still affected. They have managed to get a further 217 of our customers back on by diverting electricity, so your power may have come on sooner than we originally advised. If you're still off, please don't worry; work on the issue will continue along with SMS updates until everyone is back on.
